title: The Magician's Alliance hates The Moxie
body:
Tonight is our ARRESTED DEVELOPMENT MARATHON at The Belmonte! Woo hoo!!! I just picked up 49 chocolate-dipped bananas covered with various goodies: toasted coconut, chocolate sprinkles, crushed peanuts, and toasted almonds. I'm also taking over a giant cooler filled with tasty Fitz sodas (root beer, cream soda, and orange). The Belmonte will be providing a peanut butter and jelly bar, along with some nice warm tea. Unfortunately, I was unable to procure an illusionist. It's like I've been banned from the Magician's Alliance! I was hoping to get Tony Wonder. We're still going to have a blast - illusionist or not!

And for those of you who were curious, we're playing the episodes in sequential order - starting from the extended pilot to... whenever we're done. As a longtime AD fan, I would've loved to bounce around from episode to episode, but what about the people who aren't as familiar with the show? Fans and non-fans alike can appreciate the show in sequential order. I'm bringing season 2 with me though... just in case. Hope to see some of you there!
author: Dan

comments.author: Andy
comments.body: It's really a shame that this had to come on the same night as an Underoath show.

comments.author: Aaron J Scott
comments.body: Did you hear that there was a Bluth Family estate sale yesterday? NPR had a little bit about it. Perfect timing ... What would have been even more perfect is if you had the marathon last week when David Copperfield was here. He was a lot of fun, even if a bit self-glorifying. I'm reading "... Kavalier and Clay" again because of it all.

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body:
If David Copperfield is so powerful that he can teleport someone from Springfield to Hawaii, he should have been able to magically appear at the show to perform a few tricks last night. What a phony.

Speaking of illusions, there are TWO films about magicians coming out this year. Christopher Nolan's The Prestige (starring Christian Bale & David Bowie - together at last!) and Neil Burger's The Illusionist (starring Edward Norton & Paul Giamatti). Yes, my friends, it is truly a magical year.

comments.author: Nate
comments.body: You would think David Copperfield could make David Blaine disappear.

comments.author: Aaron Scott
comments.body: David Blaine's next feat: riding in a car for 12 hours with David Copperfield.
